modules.description: This module decodes audio data from Ogg Vorbis files using direct file access or custom callbacks for reading and seeking. It provides functions to extract raw audio samples as floating-point or integer values, retrieve metadata such as comments and stream information, and access bitstream properties like bitrate, duration, and sample count. Concrete use cases include playing back Vorbis audio, analyzing audio metadata, and converting Vorbis streams to other formats.

Generates Vorbis fisbone packets for use in Ogg Skeleton streams, with configurable serial number, sample rate, start granule, and headers. Works with raw string data and Ogg packet structures. Useful for constructing or manipulating Ogg Vorbis files with skeleton metadata.

This module provides functions for reading and writing Ogg Vorbis files directly, supporting operations such as opening files for decoding, extracting audio data, and retrieving header information. It works with raw file paths or custom input sources through callbacks, allowing integration with different I/O systems. Concrete use cases include streaming audio from disk, decoding Vorbis files into PCM data for playback, and inspecting or modifying Vorbis file metadata.

This module initializes a decoder using the first three packets of an Ogg Vorbis stream and verifies Vorbis data with `check_packet`. It extracts audio metadata and comments, and decodes PCM data into float arrays or bigarrays, supporting efficient audio playback or processing. Use cases include streaming Vorbis audio from an Ogg container and extracting track information for media applications.

This module encodes audio data into the Ogg Vorbis format using either fixed or variable bitrate settings. It operates on PCM audio buffers represented as float arrays or Bigarray float32 arrays, and handles header generation with metadata tags. Concrete use cases include streaming audio encoding, file conversion to .ogg, and real-time audio transmission with customizable bitrate and quality parameters.

This module decodes from and encodes to the Ogg Vorbis audio format, handling PCM audio buffers, metadata tags, and Ogg packets. It works with float arrays, bigarrays, hashtables for tags, and custom I/O sources for file operations. Concrete use cases include converting audio files to .ogg, streaming Vorbis audio over a network, and extracting or modifying track metadata in media applications.

Registers a Vorbis decoder for use with the `Ogg_demuxer` module, enabling decoding of Vorbis audio streams from Ogg containers. It works with Ogg bitstreams containing Vorbis-encoded audio data. A concrete use case is integrating Vorbis audio decoding into multimedia applications that process Ogg files or streams.
